User: You can change the details of this member's account here.
Người dùng: You can change the details of this member's account here.

Facilitating relationships between members is essential to building a successful social network. There are several different types of connections that can exist between members. Use this page to determine how members will associate with each other. Note that although we refer to these relationships as "friendships" in this control panel, you should use a word that best fits with your social network's theme. For example, if you are running a business-oriented social network, you may want to change this word to "connections".
Who can members invite to become their friends? Note that if you select "nobody", none of the other settings on this page will apply.

Your social network can allow either one-way or two-way friendships. The default setting is two-way friendships as this is typical for most social networks. One-way friendships mean that when MemberA adds MemberB, MemberB will appear on MemberA's friend list but NOT the reverse.

Your social network can allow either verified or unverified friendship requests. The default setting is verified friendship requests as this is typical for most social networks. Unverified friendship requests mean that when MemberA adds MemberB as a friend, MemberA and MemberB will immediately become friends without any confirmation.

Using friend lists, your members can organize their friends under various labels that they create. They can then use these lists to send messages to multiple friends and customize their privacy settings.

User: Yes, users can group their friends into lists
Người dùng: Yes, users can group their friends into lists

User: No, do not allow friend lists
Người dùng: No, do not allow friend lists

User: Specify what privacy options will be available to members in this level.
Người dùng: Specify what privacy options will be available to members in this level.
If set to "yes", members can block other members from sending them private messages, requesting their friendship, and viewing their profile. This helps fight spam and network abuse.

If set to "yes", members will be able to exclude themselves from search results and the lists of members on the homepage (such as Recent Signups). Otherwise, all members will be included in search results.

Your members can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can see their profile. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.

Your members can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can post comments on their profile. If you do not check any options, settings will default to the last saved configuration. If you select only one option, members of this level will not have a choice.
If set to "yes", members can post their "status" on their profile. By updating their status, members can tell others what they are up to, what's on their minds, etc.
If set to "yes", members will have the option of changing their username. If usernames are not enabled, this setting has no effect.
Do you want to allow members to message each other?
You can choose to use an editor to help format and add media to your messages or use the default plain textbox with buttons to add media and share when allowed.

User: If set to "yes", members will have the option of deleting their accounts.
Người dùng: If set to "yes", members will have the option of deleting their accounts.
If you have selected YES, members will be given the option of choosing a unique profile address. If you select NO, their user id will be used in the URL instead.

Người dùng: No, do not allow profile addresses.

If you have selected YES, members will automatically be enabled when they signup. If you select NO, you will need to manually enable members through the View Members page. Members that are not enabled cannot login.

User: Yes, make members agree to your terms of service on signup.

Require members to agree to your terms of service?  You can modifying your terms of service by editing the _CORE_TERMS_OF_SERVICE language variable in the application/languages/en/core.csv file.

If you have selected YES, a random password will be created for members when they signup. The password will be emailed to them upon the completion of the signup process. This is another method of verifying members' email addresses.

Force members to verify their email address before they can login? If set to YES, members will be sent an email with a verification link which they must click to activate their account.

Send Admin and email when a new user signs up? If set to YES, admin will be recieve an email with information about new user.

Do you want to turn off public signups and only allow invited members to signup? If yes, you can choose to have either admins and members invite new members, or just admins. If set to yes, an invite code will be required on the signup page.  Note that if you choose to allow only admins to invite new members then the 'Invite Your Friends' signup step will be disabled, even if you have enabled it elsewhere.

Should each invite code be bound to each invited email address? If set to NO, anyone with a valid invite code can signup regardless of their email address. If set to YES, anyone with a valid invite code that matches an email address that was invited can signup.

Tài khoản người dùng được chấp thuận
Email này được gửi tới thành viên khi tài khoản của họ được chấp thuận bởi admin.
Tài khoản của bạn được chấp thuận.

[header]

Tài khoản của bạn được chấp thuận bởi một admin. Vui lòng click đường link sau để đăng nhập:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
Email này được gửi tới thành viên khi yêu cầu kết bạn của họ được chấp thuận.
[sender_title] đã chấp nhận kết bạn với bạn.

[header]

[sender_title] đã chấp nhận yêu cầu kết bạn với bạn. Vui lòng click đường link sau để đăng nhập:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
Email này được gửi tới thành viên khi thành viên khác bắt đầu theo dõi họ.
[sender_title] đã bắt đầu theo dõi bạn.

[header]

[sender_title] đã bắt đầu theo dõi bạn. Vui lòng click đường link sau để xem thành viên:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
Email này được gửi tới thành viên khi yêu cầu theo dõi thành viên khác được chấp nhận.
[sender_title] đã chấp thuận yêu cầu theo dõi họ của bạn.

[header]

[sender_title] đã chấp thuận cho bạn theo dõi họ. Vui lòng click đường link sau để đăng nhập:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
Email này được gửi tới thành viên khi một thành viên khác yêu cầu theo dõi họ.
[sender_title] đã yêu cầu theo dõi bạn.

[header]

[sender_title] đã yêu cầu theo dõi bạn. Vui lòng click đường link sau để đăng nhập và xác nhận yêu cầu này:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
Email này được gửi tới thành viên khi một thành viên khác yêu cầu kết bạn với họ.
[sender_title] đã thêm bạn vào danh sách bạn bè.

[header]

[sender_title] đã thêm bạn vào danh sách bạn bè. Vui lòng click đường link sau để đăng nhập và xác nhận yêu cầu kết bạn này:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
Email này được gửi tới thành viên khi có người đăng tải trên hồ sơ của họ.
[sender_title] đã đăng tải trên hồ sơ của bạn

[header]

[sender_title] đã đăng tải trên hồ sơ của bạn. Vui lòng click đường link sau để xem:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
Email này được gửi tới thành viên khi có người tag bạn.

[header]

http://[host][object_link]
